Alabama.requires_race_msg: The state of Alabama requires information about your race or ethnicity.   Your application will not be rejected if you fail to provide this information.
Alabama.requires_party_msg: You do not have to register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention, and can choose  any presidential primary ballot (but not both) regardless of registration.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Alabama.id_number_msg: Please provide your Social Security number.  If you do not have a Social Security number, please enter "NONE" and a number will be assigned to you by the state.
Alabama.sos_address:
Office of the Secretary of State
Elections Division
P.O. Box 5616
Montgomery, AL 36103-5616
Alabama.sub_18_msg: if you will be 18 by the next election

Alaska.requires_race_msg: The state of Alaska does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Alaska.requires_party_msg: Alaska has a closed primary election and a caucus system for president. Each recognized political party may choose to have a separate ballot listing only candidates from their political party, or recognized political parties may choose to combine their candidates on one ballot.  Recognized political parties may also choose what political affiliations may participate in their primary election. A voter's political affiliation  30 days prior to Election Day will determine which ballot a voter may choose; however, a voter may only choose one ballot.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Alaska.id_number_msg: You must provide your Alaska driver's license number or state identification card number.  If you do not have either of those,  you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have any of these identification numbers,  please enter "NONE" and a unique identification number will be assigned to you by the state for voter registration purposes.
Alaska.sos_address:
State of Alaska
Division of Elections
PO Box 110017
Juneau, AK 99811-0017

Arizona.requires_race_msg: The state of Arizona does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Arizona.requires_party_msg: For presidential preference elections, the registrant needs to be registered under a recognized party. For all other primary elections, voters registered as independent, no party preference or members of a party without ballot recognition are allowed to vote in the partisan Primary Election of their choice of one of the recognized political parties. Voters who are registered with a recognized political party will receive their political party's early ballot. Only registered members of the Arizona Libertarian Party may vote in the Libertarian Party Primary Election.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Arizona.id_number_msg: If you have an Arizona driver's license or non-operating identification issued after October 1, 1996, write the number. If not, write "NONE" and attach proof of citizenship to the form. Only one acceptable form of proof is needed to register to vote.
Arizona.sos_address:
Secretary of State
Elections Department
1700 W. Washington, 7th Floor
Phoenix, AZ 85007-2808
Arizona.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next general election (which is usually in November)

Arkansas.requires_race_msg: The state of Arkansas does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Arkansas.requires_party_msg: You do not have to register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Arkansas.id_number_msg: You must provide your Arkansas driver's license number or non-operating identification license number.  If you do not have a driver's license or non-operating identification number, you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have any of these forms of identification, please enter "NONE" and a unique identifying number will be assigned by the state.
Arkansas.sos_address:
Secretary of State
500 Woodlane Street, Suite 256
Little Rock, AR 72201-8111
Arkansas.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

California.requires_race_msg: The state of California does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
California.requires_party_msg: If you wish to choose a party preference, please enter the name of the political party. If you do not want to choose a political party, select “No Party Preference. California law allows voters who choose “No Party Preference” or have chosen a preference for a nonqualified political party to vote in the presidential primary election of any qualified political party that files a notice with the Secretary of State allowing them to do so. You can call 1-800-345-VOTE or visit www.sos.ca.gov to learn which political parties allow “No Party Preference” voters and voters who have disclosed a preference for a nonqualified political party to participate in their presidential primary election.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
California.id_number_msg: You must provide your California driver's license or California identification card number.  If you do not have either a driver's license or ID card, you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not include this information, write "NONE" and you will be required to provide identification when you vote.
California.sos_address:
Secretary of State
Elections Division
1500 11th Street, 5th FL
Sacramento, CA 95814
California.sub_18_msg: once you have turned 16 years old (but you cannot vote until you turn 18)

Colorado.requires_race_msg: The state of Colorado does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Colorado.requires_party_msg: You may register with a party. If you leave this section blank you will not be registered with any party.

Colorado.id_number_msg: Your completed voter registration form must contain your state issued driver's license number or identification number. If you do not have a driver's license or a state issued identification or a social security number, please write "NONE" on the form. A unique identifying number will be assigned by the State.
Colorado.sos_address:

1700 Broadway, Suite 550
Denver, CO 80290
Colorado.sub_18_msg: once you have turned 16 years old (but you cannot vote until you turn 18)

Idaho.requires_race_msg: The state of Idaho does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Idaho.requires_party_msg: You must register with a party if you want to participate in that party's election. Enter your Political Party Preference. Illinois.requires_race_msg: The state of Illinois does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Illinois.requires_party_msg: Leave Blank. Exception: for primary elections, unless a voter only wishes to vote on public questions, a party preference should be indicated.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Illinois.id_number_msg: Illinois requires either the Driver's License (or Secretary of State ID Card) or the last 4 digits of Social Security Number. For people who do not have either of those items, and have not registered in Illinois before, a mail in registration form should be accompanied by a copy of other identifying information: you must send, with this application, either (i) a copy of a current and valid photo identification, or (ii) a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows the name and address of the voter. If you do not provide the information required above, then you will be required to provide election officials with either (i) or (ii) described above the first time you vote at a voting place.
Illinois.sos_address:
State Board of Elections
2329 S. MacArthur Boulevard
Springfield, IL 62704

Louisiana.requires_race_msg: The state of Louisiana requests information about your race or ethnicity.  Your application will not be rejected if you fail to provide this information.
Louisiana.requires_party_msg: If you do not list a party affiliation, you cannot vote in the Presidential Preference Primary and party committee elections.  Political party affiliation is not required for any other election.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Louisiana.id_number_msg: You must provide your Louisiana driver's license number or Louisiana special  identification card number, if issued. If not issued, you must provide at least  the last four digits of your social security number, if issued. The full social  security number may be provided on a voluntary basis. If the applicant has  neither a Louisiana driver's license, a Louisiana special identification card,  or a social security number, write "NONE" and the applicant shall attach one of the following  items to his application: (a) a copy of a current and valid photo  identification; or (b) a copy of a current utility bill, bank statement,  government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows the name and  address of applicant. Neither the registrar nor the Department of State shall  disclose the social security number of a registered voter or circulate the social  security numbers of registered voters on commercial lists (R.S. 18:104 and 154;  42 U.S.C. § 405).
Louisiana.sos_address:
Secretary of State
Voter Registration
8585 Archives Ave.
Baton Rouge, LA 70809

North Carolina.requires_party_msg: North Carolina has a semi-closed primary system.  Voters affiliated with a political party may only vote in that party's primary. In a primary, unaffiliated voters may choose to vote either a partisan ballot or a non-partisan ballot.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
North Carolina.id_number_msg: You must provide your North Carolina driver's license number or Department of Motor Vehicles identification number.  If you do not have a driver's license or identification number, you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have any of these, enter "NONE" and the state will assign you an identification number.
North Carolina.sos_address:
State Board of Elections
P.O. Box 27255
Raleigh, NC 27611-7255
North Carolina.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

North Dakota.message:
GREAT NEWS! NORTH DAKOTA DOES NOT REQUIRE RESIDENTS TO REGISTER TO VOTE.

North Dakota does not have voter registration. For more information, contact your Secretary of State’s office at 701-328-4146 or visit Vote.ND.Gov.

Ohio.requires_race_msg: The state of Ohio does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Ohio.requires_party_msg: Party affiliation is not a component of voter registration. You declare your party affiliation by requesting the ballot of a political party in a partisan primary election.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Ohio.id_number_msg: Your Social Security number is requested.  Providing this information is voluntary.   If you do not provide your Social Security number, you must enter your driver's license number or the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you don't have either number, please enter "NONE" and the state will assign you a number.
Ohio.sos_address:
Secretary of State of Ohio
22 North Fourth Street, 16th Floor
Columbus, Ohio 43215
Ohio.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election in November

Oklahoma.requires_race_msg: The state of Oklahoma does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Oklahoma.requires_party_msg: You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Oklahoma.id_number_msg: You must provide one of these numbers: either your valid Oklahoma driver's license number or state identification card number or the last four digits of your Social Security number.
Oklahoma.sos_address:
Oklahoma State Election Board
2300 N Lincoln Blvd, Room G28
State Capitol Building
Oklahoma City, OK 73105
Oklahoma.sub_18_msg: if it is 60 days before the next election and you will be 18 years old by that election (usually in November)

Oregon.requires_race_msg: The state of Oregon does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Oregon.requires_party_msg: In many cases, you must register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election. If you are not a member of a party or you select none, you will be registered as a nonaffiliated voter.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Oregon.id_number_msg: You must provide your Oregon driver's license number or non-driver identification number.  If you do not have either of those, please provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have a driver's license, identification card, or Social Security number, please enter "NONE" and an identification number will be assigned to you by the state.
Oregon.sos_address:
Oregon Secretary of State Elections Division
Public Service Building Suite 501
255 Capitol St. NE
Salem OR 97310
Oregon.sub_18_msg: once you have turned 16 years old (but you cannot vote until you turn 18)

Pennsylvania.requires_race_msg: The state of Pennsylvania requests information about your race or ethnicity.
Pennsylvania.requires_party_msg: You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Pennsylvania.id_number_msg: You must provide your driver's license number, if you have one. If you do not have a driver's license number, you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number. If you do not have either number, please write "NONE."
Pennsylvania.sos_address:
Office of the Secretary, Bureau of Elections and Notaries
210 North Office Building
401 North Street
Harrisburg, PA 17120
Pennsylvania.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

Rhode Island.requires_race_msg: The state of Rhode Island does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Rhode Island.requires_party_msg: In Rhode Island, a person must register with a party if they wish to take part in that party's primary election. A person who fails to register with a party at the time of registration may, if they choose, register with a party on the day of that party's primary and take part in that party's primary election. If a person does not register with a party, they can still vote in general elections and nonpartisan primary elections.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Rhode Island.id_number_msg: The applicant shall be required to provide their Rhode Island driver's license or State ID number if the applicant has been issued a current and valid Rhode Island driver's license or State ID. In the case of an applicant who has not been issued a current and valid driver's license or State ID, they must provide the last four (4) digits of their social security number. An applicant, who has neither, may enter "NONE" and will be assigned a unique identifying number by the State of Rhode Island.
Rhode Island.sos_address:
Rhode Island Board of Elections
148 West River St.
Providence, RI 02904
Rhode Island.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

South Carolina.requires_race_msg: The state of South Carolina requires information about your race or ethnicity.
South Carolina.requires_party_msg: You do not have to register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
South Carolina.id_number_msg: You must provide at least the last four digits of your social security number.  You may provide your full social security number on a voluntary basis. Social  security number does not appear on any report produced by the State Election  Commission nor is it released to any unauthorized individual. (South Carolina  Title 7-5-170)
South Carolina.sos_address:
State Election Commission
1122 Lady Street, Suite 500
Columbia, SC 29201
South Carolina.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

South Dakota.requires_race_msg: The state of South Dakota does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
South Dakota.requires_party_msg: If you are currently registered to vote and you leave the choice of party field blank, you will remain registered with your current party affiliation. If you are not currently registered to vote and you leave the choice of party field blank, you will be entered as an independent/no party affiliation voter, which is not a political party in South Dakota.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
South Dakota.id_number_msg: You must provide your valid South Dakota driver license number or a South Dakota nondriver identification number. If you do not have a valid South Dakota driver license or a South Dakota nondriver identification number, provide the last four digits of your social security number. If you do not have any of these, you may only register at the county auditor's office.
South Dakota.sos_address:
Secretary of State
Capitol Building
500 East Capitol Avenue Ste 204
Pierre, SD 57501-5070
South Dakota.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

Tennessee.requires_race_msg: The state of Tennessee requests information about your race or ethnicity, but it is not required.
Tennessee.requires_party_msg: Tennessee does not register by political party. When you wish to vote in a primary election, you will have to declare a party at that time.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Tennessee.id_number_msg: Your full social security number is required. Social security number, if any, is required for purposes of identification and to avoid duplicate registration (TCA 2.2.116).
Tennessee.sos_address:
Elections
312 Rosa L. Parks Avenue
7th Floor, Snodgrass Tower
Nashville , TN 37243-1102
Tennessee.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

Texas.requires_race_msg: The state of Texas does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Texas.requires_party_msg: You do not have to register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Texas.id_number_msg: You must provide your Texas driver's license or Texas personal identification number to register to vote. If you do not have a Texas driver's license or Texas personal identification card then you will have to provide at least the last four digits of your social security number. If you have neither, please write "NONE" on the form. A unique identifying number will instead be assigned to you by your State.
Texas.sos_address:
Elections Division
Secretary of State
P.O. Box 12060
Austin, TX 78711-2060

Utah.requires_race_msg: The state of Utah does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Utah.requires_party_msg: Utah's election law allows each political party to choose whom it will allow to vote in its primary election.  If you do not affiliate with a party, you may be restricted from voting in the primary.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Utah.id_number_msg: You must provide your state-issued driver's license number or non-operating identification license number.  If you do not have a driver's license or non-operating identification number, you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have any of these forms of identification, please enter "NONE" and a unique identifying number will be assigned by the state.
Utah.sos_address:
Office of the Lieutenant Governor
350 North State Street, Suite 220
P.O. Box 142325
Salt Lake City, Utah 84114-2325
Utah.sub_18_msg: once you have turned 16 years old (but you cannot vote until you turn 18)

Vermont.requires_race_msg: The state of Vermont does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Vermont.requires_party_msg: Vermont Laws do not allow party registration to participate in any election.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Vermont.id_number_msg: You must provide your driver's license number.  If you do not have a driver's license number, you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have either number, enter "NONE" and a unique identifying number will be assigned to you by the state.
Vermont.sos_address:
Elections Division
128 State Street
Montpelier, VT 05633-1101
Vermont.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

Virginia.requires_race_msg: The Commonwealth of Virginia does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Virginia.requires_party_msg: You do not have to register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention. However, if you are eligible to vote absentee and wish to participate in a party primary, your absentee ballot application must identify the party for which primary ballots should be sent.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Virginia.id_number_msg: Your full Social Security number is required.
Virginia.sos_address:
Virginia Department of Elections
Washington Building, First Floor
1100 Bank Street, Richmond 23219
Virginia.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

Washington.requires_race_msg: The state of Washington does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Washington.requires_party_msg: Washington State does not register voters according to political party.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Washington.id_number_msg: You must provide your Washington driver's license or ID card number. If you do  not have a Washington driver's license or ID card, you must provide the last  four digits of your Social Security Number. Failure to provide this information  may prevent your registration from being processed.
Washington.sos_address:
State Elections Division
520 Union Ave SE
P.O. Box 40229
Olympia, WA 98504-0230
Washington.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 by the next election

West Virginia.requires_race_msg: The state of West Virginia does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
West Virginia.requires_party_msg: You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party's primary election, caucus, or convention (unless you request the ballot of a party which allows independents to vote).
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
West Virginia.id_number_msg: You must provide your driver's license or non-driver ID number.  If you do not have a driver's license or non-driver ID number, then you must provide the last four digits of your Social Security number.  If you do not have a driver's license or a Social Security number, please enter "NONE" and the state will assign you an identification number for the purposes of voting.
West Virginia.sos_address:
Office of the Secretary of State
State Capitol Building
Charleston, WV 25305
West Virginia.sub_18_msg: if you will turn 18 before the next election

Wisconsin.requires_race_msg: The state of Wisconsin does not request information about your race or ethnicity.  However, we would appreciate this information in order  to measure the effectiveness of our voter registration efforts.
Wisconsin.requires_party_msg: You are not required to designate your party affiliation to register to vote in Wisconsin.
race_list: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Wisconsin.id_number_msg: Provide your unexpired Wisconsin driver license or DOT-issued ID card number. If you do not have a current and valid DOT-issued driver license or ID card, provide the last four digits of your social security number.
Wisconsin.sos_address:
State of Wisconsin Elections Commission
212 East Washington Ave
3rd Floor
Madison, WI 53703
Wisconsin.sub_18_msg: if you are 17 and will turn 18 before the next election

Wyoming.message: Wyoming law does not allow you to use this form to register to vote.  To learn more about registering to vote in Wyoming, please contact the county clerk where you live.  Contact information can be found at http://soswy.state.wy.us/Elections/RegisteringToVote.aspx or by calling 307-777-3573.
